SEARCH
Package com.api.synco.core.persistence.user.specification

Class UserSpecifications

java.lang.Object
com.api.synco.module.user.infrastructure.specification.UserSpecifications
public class UserSpecifications extends Object
Utility class containing JPA Specifications for querying UserEntity.

This class provides reusable, composable specifications that can be combined using Spring Data JPA's specification API to build dynamic queries for user filtering and searching.

Each specification method returns a Specification that can be combined with others using and(), or(), and not() methods.

Example usage:


 Specification<UserEntity> spec = UserSpecifications.nameContains("John")
     .and(UserSpecifications.roleEquals(RoleUser.ADMIN));
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Luca5Eckert

  • Method Details

    • nameContains

      public static org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<UserEntity> nameContains(String name)
      Creates a specification to filter users by name containing the given value.

      The search is case-insensitive and matches any part of the name.

      Parameters:
      name - the name substring to search for (can be null or blank to skip filter)
      Returns:
      a specification for name filtering, or null if name is blank/null

    • emailContains

      public static org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<UserEntity> emailContains(String email)
      Creates a specification to filter users by email containing the given value.

      The search is case-insensitive and matches any part of the email address.

      Parameters:
      email - the email substring to search for (can be null or blank to skip filter)
      Returns:
      a specification for email filtering, or null if email is blank/null

    • roleEquals

      public static org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<UserEntity> roleEquals(RoleUser role)
      Creates a specification to filter users by exact role match.
      Parameters:
      role - the role to match (can be null to skip filter)
      Returns:
      a specification for role filtering, or null if role is null

    • createdBetween

      public static org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<UserEntity> createdBetween(Instant from, Instant to)
      Creates a specification to filter users by creation date range.

      Both bounds are inclusive. If either bound is null, a default value is used:

      • If from is null, Instant.EPOCH is used
      • If to is null, Instant.now() is used
      Parameters:
      from - the start of the date range (inclusive, can be null)
      to - the end of the date range (inclusive, can be null)
      Returns:
      a specification for date range filtering, or null if both bounds are null
